question: [File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: start()] [State mutation after start] Can register_handler() be called after start(), causing handlers to be registered in a moved-out Vec? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Struct: OutboundHandler] [Mutable state] Does OutboundHandler need interior mutability for remote_addresses and handlers, or can concurrent access cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: register_handler()] [Registration after start] Is there a happens-before relationship between register_handler() and start() to prevent data races? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Message replay] Can messages be replayed by capturing and resending them through the same handler, bypassing nonce checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Message amplification] Can a single message sent to one receiver trigger cascading sends to multiple receivers, amplifying network traffic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Message dropping] Can selective message dropping by not calling send_message() be used to censor specific consensus votes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [InboundHandler coupling] Does tight coupling between OutboundHandler and InboundHandler create cyclic dependencies that prevent proper shutdown? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: start()] [GRPCNetworkMessageServiceClientWrapper trust] Does OutboundHandler assume GRPC wrapper provides authentication, or can unauthenticated connections be established? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Message serialization] Can Message objects contain malicious data that exploits serialization vulnerabilities in GRPC layer? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: start()] [Empty remote_addresses] What happens if start() is called with registered handlers but empty remote_addresses HashSet? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: register_handler()] [Duplicate handlers] Can multiple handlers be registered for the same (remote_addr, message_type) pair, causing duplicate message sends? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Zero-size messages] Can zero-sized or empty Message objects cause protocol violations when sent over GRPC? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Handler removal] Can handlers be removed from the Vec during processing, causing index to become invalid? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Infinite blocking] Can Select::select() block indefinitely if all receivers are empty and no senders exist? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Graceful degradation] If one GRPC client fails repeatedly, does it prevent other clients from sending messages, causing partial network partition? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: start()] [Shutdown coordination] Can OutboundHandler be stopped gracefully without losing in-flight messages during validator shutdown? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Unwrap usage] Does unwrap() on lock() and get_mut() hide potential errors that should be handled, causing panics in production? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: register_handler()] [Lifetime issues] Can Receiver lifetimes outlive OutboundHandler, causing use-after-free when messages are sent after handler is dropped? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: start()] [Move semantics] Does moving outbound_handlers into the async block prevent any future access, or can dangling references exist? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [CPU monopolization] Can the infinite loop without yield points monopolize a Tokio worker thread, preventing other async tasks from running? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: register_handler()] [Vec growth pattern] Does Vec::push() cause repeated reallocations if many handlers are registered, causing performance degradation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Select overhead] Can the overhead of rebuilding Select in each loop iteration cause latency spikes for time-sensitive consensus messages? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [FIFO violation] Can messages from the same sender to the same receiver be delivered out of order due to async execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Causal ordering] Can consensus messages violate causal ordering if sent to multiple validators through different handlers? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/secure/net/src/network_controller/outbound_handler.rs] [Function: process_one_outgoing_message()] [Message duplication] Can the same message be sent multiple times if send_message().await is retried on failure? (Medium)
